data.title: The Great K. & A. Train-Robbery
data.meta_description: Early Reprint Edition. Octavo, original illustrated cloth and dustjacket. Hubin listed mystery novel set in Arizona and concerning a train hold-up. An early dustjacketed copy of this mystery published by a contemporary reprint house originated by Frank F. Lovell the American publisher who sells books by the millions at twenty five cents through Departmental Stores. Near Fine in Very Good dustjacket, nicked at spine ends.
data.meta_site_name: Yesterday's Gallery and Babylon Revisited Rare Books
data.text:
FORD, Paul Leicester. The Great K. & A. Train-Robbery. New York: International Association of Newspapers and Authors, 1901.

Early Reprint Edition. Octavo, original illustrated cloth and dustjacket. Hubin listed mystery novel set in Arizona and concerning a train hold-up. An early dustjacketed copy of this mystery published by a contemporary reprint house originated by Frank F. Lovell the American publisher "who sells books by the millions at twenty five cents through Departmental Stores." Near Fine in Very Good dustjacket, nicked at spine ends.
